page.title: 14Page 14 Government - Closure
page.content: The decision to close Goring Heath Endowed C/E School was made by Sir Keith Joseph,Secretary of State for Education, in May 1985, after a year long battle by parents and friends of the school to prevent the closure. Parents submitted objections to the closure proposal in December 1984. They were hopeful that the Local Government Ombudsman's decision to investigate the manner in which Oxfordshire dealt with the closure proposal and the fact that a new County Council had been elected{a HUNG Council},might delay a final decision and enable the school to remain open. However, before the new Education Committee had met, Sir Keith Joseph stepped in to close the school. The County will provide transport to Checkendon C/E School for those children transfering there. There will be 20 pupils when the school closes.
